info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 3:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mesa County through 415 PM MDT... At 349 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palisade, or 12 miles east of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Mesa County, including the following locations... Clifton, Cameo, Fruitvale and Orchard Mesa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 31 and 51. Colorado 65 between mile markers 58 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 157 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
